p: In recent years, inflammatory processes have been correlated to the development of chronic diseases. However, chronic inflammation and cytokine dysfunction are associated with conditions such as cancer progression, cardiovascular disease, diabetes, and neurodegenerative disease [ 66]. To better study these molecular aspects, inflammatory models using microglial [ 29] and astrocyte [ 43] cell lines have been used to evaluate the influence of inflammatory processes on the development of neurodegenerative diseases and tumor cell lines such as HepG2 [ 27] to evaluate the relationship between the processes inflammatory and malignant neoplasms.
